(Circulated by direction of the Chancellor of theExchequer).I aslc authority to introduce the Expiring Laws. continuance bill, 1935, in the form of the draft attached hereto before the adjournment of Parliament. The Bill must become lav/ by the51st December, 1933.All the enactments in the Schedule to the Bill were continued by the Act of 1932. There are no additions; butthe following six Acts, which have been dealt with by separate legislation are no longer included in the Schedule, viz:Increase of Rent Act, 1920Cotton Industry Act, 1924London Traffic Act, 1924Unemployment Insurance- Act, 1930Unemployment Insurance (No.5) Act, 1931Transitional Payments (Determination of Need) Act, 1952.The Dyestuffs (import Regulation) Act, 1920, is included in the Schedule for the present pending a decision by the Cabinet as to the action to be taken.Before the Bill is issued, a decision will also be necessary on the inclusion of the Unemployment (Relief Works) Act, 1920 and of Sections 1 and 4 of the Public Works Facilities Act, 1930, in the Bill. Provisionally the whole of each of these Acts has been included in the Schedule of the draft Bill now circulated. The Minister of Health has suggested that the former Act (with which is involved Section 4 of the latter Act) might without detriment he omitted from the Schedule; and that, in view of the debate in the House of Lords (20 Dec, 1932, cols- 487 et seqy) on Section 1 of . the latter Act, it might not be desirable to prolong that Section. He has requested that the special attention of the Cabinet might be directed to these points.The remainder of the Public Works Facilities Acts, 1930, (viz. all except Sections 1 and 4) should in any event be continued.Subject to these points, the draft Bill has been agreed with all the Departments concerned.(Initialled) L.H-B.reasury Chambers, S.W.1.
